intro: Peucedanum macedonicum, commonly known as Macedonian cow parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its seeds are small and oval, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Peucedanum macedonicum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
